title: An exploratory study of neoadjuvant tislelizumab combined with TP regimen for the comprehensive treatment of resectable locally advanced oral squamous cell carcinoma.
indication: resectable locally advanced oral squamous cell carcinoma (LA OSCC)
treatment_arm: Tislelizumab (200mg) and platinum-doublet chemotherapy[albumin-bound paclitaxel (240 mg/m2) plus cisplatin (70 mg/m2)] on day 1 Q3W for three cycles
study_population: eligible patients with untreated locally advanced, resectable OSCC (T3-4bN0-3M0; stage III-IVb, AJCC 8th Edition)
study_size: n=20 enrolled; n=20 completed neoadjuvant therapy; n=20 received surgery.

title: Primary results of a phase 2 study of cisplatin-sensitized radiation therapy and pembrolizumab for unresectable vulvar cancer.
indication: primary unresectable, incompletely resected, recurrent, or metastatic squamous cell carcinoma of the vulva
mechanism_of_action: immune checkpoint inhibitors could synergize with chemotherapy
treatment_arm: cisplatin 40 mg/m2 weekly concurrently with intensity modulated (IM) RT, and pembrolizumab 200 mg was administered every three weeks for a total of 12 cycles
study_population: patients with primary unresectable, incompletely resected, recurrent, or metastatic squamous cell carcinoma of the vulva undergoing RT. Patients who had received prior chemotherapy were also eligible.
study_size: n=24 enrolled; data cutoff 01/22/2025.
line_of_therapy: primary unresectable, incompletely resected, recurrent, or metastatic

title: C3NIRA: Randomized phase II study of carboplatin-cabazitaxel-cetrelimab (anti-PD-1) induction followed by niraparib +/- cetrelimab maintenance in men with aggressive variant prostate cancers (AVPC).
indication: aggressive variant prostate cancers (AVPC)
mechanism_of_action: anti-PD-1
control_arm: Nira 300mg BID
treatment_arm: Nira 300mg BID + Cet
study_population: men with CRPC meeting ≥ 1 of 9 AVPC criteria and ECOG performance status 0-2
study_size: 120 patients started induction therapy, of whom 60 were randomized 1:1 to the niraparib arm (n=30) or the niraparib + cetrelimab arm (n=30); post-randomization median follow up was 20.5 mo.
line_of_therapy: castration-resistant prostate cancer (CRPC) with aggressive variant features

title: Results of a randomized phase III trial of pre-operative chemotherapy with mFOLFIRINOX or PAXG regimen for stage I-III pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma.
indication: stage I-III pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma
control_arm: mFOLFIRINOX (biweekly 5-fluorouracil 2400 mg/m2, irinotecan 150 mg/m2, oxaliplatin 85 mg/m2; arm B)
treatment_arm: PAXG (oral daily capecitabine 1250 mg/m2 with biweekly cisplatin 30 mg/m2, nab-paclitaxel 150 mg/m2, gemcitabine 800 mg/m2; arm A)
study_population: patients (pts) ≤75y with resectable/borderline resectable (R/BR) pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma (PDAC), stratified by site and CA19.9
study_size: A total of 260 eligible patients were randomly assigned to arm A (n=132) or arm B (n=128); median follow-up was 23.9 mos at the data cutoff of March 1, 2025.

title: Darolutamide plus goserelin for androgen receptor-positive salivary gland cancers: Results of phase 2 study (DISCOVARY).
indication: unresectable locally advanced (LA) or recurrent/metastatic (R/M) androgen receptor (AR)-positive salivary gland cancer (SGC)
mechanism_of_action: combined androgen blockade (CAB)
treatment_arm: darolutamide orally at 1,200mg daily, combined with goserelin at 3.6 mg every four weeks
study_population: Eligible patients had histologically confirmed AR-positive LA or R/M SGC, ECOG performance status (PS) 0–2, adequate organ function, and no local therapy options.
study_size: 33 patients were enrolled in the combination phase, with an analysis set of n=31 for ORR; data cutoff was August 9, 2024, with a median follow-up of 13.7 mo.

title: A phase 1 study of intracerebroventricular (ICV) delivery of bivalent chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) T-cells targeting EGFR and IL13Ra2 in patients with recurrent glioblastoma (rGBM).
indication: recurrent glioblastoma (rGBM)
mechanism_of_action: bivalent chimeric antigen receptor (CAR) T-cells targeting EGFR and IL13Ra2
treatment_arm: A single ICV dose of CART-EGFR-IL13Rα2 cells without lymphodepleting chemotherapy, at dose levels of 5.0 x 10^6, 1.0 x 10^7, and 2.5 x 10^7 cells.
study_population: Patients with EGFR-amplified GBM that was recurrent/progressive following front-line radiotherapy were enrolled.
study_size: Total n=18 patients received treatment (n=6 per dose level); one patient had ongoing durable stable disease at 17 months at data cut-off.

title: A phase II prospective, open-label, multi-center, single-arm study of sasanlimab plus sacituzumab govitecan in BCG-unresponsive non-muscle invasive bladder cancer (NMIBC) pts: SSANTROP (APRO07-2022).
indication: BCG-unresponsive non-muscle invasive bladder cancer (NMIBC)
mechanism_of_action: sasanlimab (Sa), a subcutaneous (SC) anti-PD1 agent
treatment_arm: sasanlimab (5 cy of Sa 300 mg SC on day 1 every 28 days) plus sacituzumab govitecan (7 cy of SG 10 mg/kg IV on days 1 and every 21 days)
study_population: BCG-unresponsive non-muscle invasive bladder cancer (NMIBC) pts with ECOG PS 0-1, histologically confirmed BCG-unresponsive HR NMIBC, refusal or ineligibility for RC, urothelial carcinoma histology, and no prior anti-PD1/L1 or anti-CTLA-4 therapy.
study_size: Planned n=116 (modified to n=40), screened n=59, treated (safety analysis) n=41, response-evaluable n=25, 18 sites in Spain, data cut-off January 21, 2025 (safety) and December 2024 (efficacy).

title: Safety and tolerability of dostarlimab in combination antiretroviral therapy–refractory HIV-associated Kaposi sarcoma: Preliminary results from the StarKap phase Ib trial.
indication: HIV-associated Kaposi’s Sarcoma (KS)
mechanism_of_action: Programmed Cell Death-1 (PD-1) blockade may lead to anti-tumour immune reconstitution.
treatment_arm: 4-weekly dostarlimab 500 mg for 4 cycles followed by 6-weekly 1000 mg for up to 1 year
study_population: patients (pts) with well-controlled HIV and anti-retroviral (cART) refractory KS
study_size: A total of n=13 patients were enrolled, with n=10 evaluable for safety and efficacy at cycle 4; data cut-off was 12/2024.

title: Pathologic response to neoadjuvant sequenced, lymphatic-sparing SBRT plus pembrolizumab in HPV-negative head and neck squamous cell carcinoma.
indication: locoregionally advanced HPV-negative head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (HNSCC)
mechanism_of_action: anti-PD-1
control_arm: historical controls of anti-PD-1 alone
treatment_arm: Neoadjuvant therapy consisted of SBRT 8Gy X 3 delivered over 1 week (GTV +/-3mm) followed by 3 cycles of pembrolizumab (200mg) prior to definitive surgical resection + neck dissection at week 7.
study_population: patients (pts) with resectable clinical stage III-IVA HPV-negative HNSCC who would warrant adjuvant RT per the investigators
study_size: Enrolled n=27 pts, of whom n=22 had completed surgery at time of analysis, with a median follow-up of 8.5 mo.

title: The preliminary results of a randomized phase II trial evaluating induction toripalimab plus chemotherapy followed by concurrent chemoradiotherapy and consolidation toripalimab in bulky unresectable stage III non-small-cell lung cancer (InTRist).
indication: bulky unresectable stage III non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC)
control_arm: induction chemotherapy alone for 2 cycles followed by concurrent CRT (60 Gy radiotherapy plus concurrent platinum-based chemotherapy). Patients without disease progression or grade ≥2 pneumonitis after CRT received consolidation toripalimab (240 mg every 3 weeks) for up to 12 months.
treatment_arm: induction toripalimab (240 mg every 3 weeks) plus platinum-based doublet chemotherapy for 2 cycles followed by concurrent CRT (60 Gy radiotherapy plus concurrent platinum-based chemotherapy). Patients without disease progression or grade ≥2 pneumonitis after CRT received consolidation toripalimab (240 mg every 3 weeks) for up to 12 months.
study_population: patients with unresectable stage III NSCLC with bulky diseases, and without EGFR/ALK alterations. Bulky diseases were defined as primary tumor ≥5 cm in greatest dimension or metastatic lymph nodes ≥2 cm in shortest diameter.
study_size: 52 patients were randomized to the induction toripalimab group (n=27) or chemo group (n=25); median follow-up was 13.1 mo at the January 15th, 2025 data cutoff.

title: Camrelizumab plus nab-paclitaxel and cisplatin as first-line treatment for metastatic triple-negative breast cancer: A prospective, single-arm, open-label phase II trial.
indication: first-line treatment for metastatic triple-negative breast cancer (mTNBC)
mechanism_of_action: humanized monoclonal antibody against PD-1
treatment_arm: camrelizumab (200 mg D1), nab-paclitaxel (125 mg/m2 D1,D8) and cisplatin (75 mg/m2 D1) intravenously every 3 weeks
study_population: Patients with untreated mTNBC; median age was 51 years; 46.7% of patients had three or more metastatic sites; 78.9% of patients had visceral involvement; 82.2% of patients had taxanes exposure.
study_size: A total of 90 patients were enrolled; data cutoff was July 10th 2024, with a median follow-up of 18.1 mo.

title: 15-year outcomes for women with premenopausal hormone receptor-positive early breast cancer (BC) in the SOFT and TEXT trials assessing benefits from adjuvant exemestane (E) + ovarian function suppression (OFS) or tamoxifen (T)+OFS.
indication: premenopausal hormone receptor-positive early breast cancer (BC)
mechanism_of_action: aromatase inhibitor-containing adjuvant endocrine therapy
control_arm: 5y tamoxifen + ovarian function suppression (T+OFS) or 5y tamoxifen (T) alone
treatment_arm: 5y exemestane + ovarian function suppression (E+OFS)
study_population: premenopausal women with HR+ early BC
study_size: SOFT and TEXT enrolled 2660 women in TEXT and 3047 in SOFT (intention-to-treat populations); the TEXT+SOFT combined analysis compared E+OFS (n=2346) vs T+OFS (n=2344); median follow-up was 15y in SOFT and 16.6y in TEXT.

title: Phase I/II study of maintenance therapy with metformin and temozolomide for newly diagnosed glioblastoma.
indication: maintenance therapy for newly diagnosed glioblastoma
mechanism_of_action: induces the differentiation of stem-like glioma-initiating cells and suppresses tumor formation via AMPK-FOXO3 activation
treatment_arm: MF monotherapy for 14 days, followed by six cycles of TMZ combined with daily MF (2,250 mg) for 365 days.
study_population: Patients aged 20–74 years with supratentorial GBM, Karnofsky Performance Status ≥ 70, and a history of initial chemoradiotherapy with TMZ were eligible.
study_size: A total of 22 patients were enrolled in 5 hospitals, with 21 patients receiving the treatment combination.

title: Phase I trial of capecitabine with cemiplimab in patients with hormone receptor–positive metastatic breast cancer.
indication: hormone receptor positive (HR+) HER2 negative metastatic breast cancer (MBC)
mechanism_of_action: Capecitabine has shown immunomodulatory activity by increasing interferon-gamma from activated tumor infiltrating immune cells, thus inducing PD-L1 expression.
treatment_arm: A fixed dose of cemipilimab IV 350 mg on day 1 in combination with Capecitabine orally twice daily for 14 days on and 7 days off starting on day 3 of a 21-day cycle. Patients were started at capecitabine 800 mg/m2 and if well tolerated then increased to 1000 mg/m2.
study_population: Patients with HR+/HER2- MBC without prior chemotherapy or immunotherapy who had progression on prior endocrine treatment (1 to 6 lines) and prior treatment with a CDK4/6 inhibitor (92.3%).
study_size: Thirteen eligible patients (n=13) were enrolled.

title: TACE with or without lenvatinib as adjuvant therapy for HCC with microvascular invasion (MVI) or portal vein thrombus (Cheng’s I/II): A single-center, prospective, non-randomized cohort study.
indication: adjuvant therapy for HCC with microvascular invasion (MVI) or portal vein thrombus (Cheng’s I/II) after radical resection
control_arm: TACE alone
treatment_arm: lenvatinib (8mg qd for weights < 60kg and 12mg qd for weights≥60kg) in combination with TACE (Len+TACE)
study_population: Patients who underwent radical resection of HCC with MVI or PVTT (Cheng's Classification I/II).
study_size: A total of 74 patients were included, with 37 patients in the Len+TACE group and 37 in the TACE group.

title: mFOLFIRINOX efficacy as rescue regimen for patients with metastatic refractory colorectal cancer: The RE-PLAY trial.
indication: metastatic refractory colorectal cancer (mCCR)
treatment_arm: The mFOLFIRINOX regimen consisted of 5-FU (2400 mg/m², continuous infusion over 46 hours), Ox (85 mg/m², D1), Ir (150 mg/m², D1), and leucovorin (200 mg/m², D1), administered every 14 days.
study_population: Eligible pts had mCCR with documented progression after treatment with doublets or sequential monotherapy regimens containing F, Ox, and Ir. Pts with RAS wild-type tumors were required to be refractory to anti-EGFR therapy.
study_size: 25 pts were enrolled (ITT n=25), with 22 pts receiving at least one cycle of treatment; median follow-up was 6.8 mo.

title: The first-in-human phase 1/2 study of TSN1611, a highly selective KRAS G12D inhibitor, in patients with advanced solid tumors.
indication: advanced solid tumors harboring KRAS G12D mutation
mechanism_of_action: TSN1611 is a novel small molecule KRAS G12D inhibitor targeting both active (GTP-bound) and inactive (GDP-bound) forms of KRAS G12D protein.
treatment_arm: Pts received oral TSN1611 twice daily (BID), until disease progression, unacceptable toxicity, or patient withdrawal. Doses ranged from 50 to 600 mg BID.
study_population: patients (pts) with advanced solid tumors harboring KRAS G12D mutation, with a median age of 61 years and a median of 3 prior lines of systemic therapy.
study_size: As of Jan 05, 2025, n=18 patients were enrolled and received TSN1611, with n=13 evaluable for response.

title: Efficacy and safety of surufatinib (S) plus KN046 (K) and chemotherapy in first line (1L) advanced pancreatic cancer (PC): A single-arm, phase 1b/2 trial.
indication: first line (1L) advanced pancreatic cancer (PC)
mechanism_of_action: K is a humanized bispecific antibody targeting PD-L1/CTLA-4, while S is a kinase inhibitor of VEGFR1-3, FGFR1 and CSF-1R with immune-regulatory potential.
treatment_arm: oral surufatinib (S) at escalating dose starting from 200 mg qd (RP2D determined as 250mg qd), plus intravenous KN046 (K) at 5 mg/kg on day 1, and GnP (Gemcitabine and nab-paclitaxel) chemotherapy on days 1 and 8 at 21-day cycles.
study_population: enrolled pts with unresectable locally advanced or metastatic PC who were eligible for 1L treatment.
study_size: 18 patients were enrolled (n=9 in phase 1b, n=16 evaluable) with a median follow-up of 7.43 mo as of the Dec 19th, 2024 data cutoff.

title: A phase II basket trial evaluating the efficacy of tasurgratinib (E7090) in patients with advanced solid tumors with fibroblast growth factor receptor (FGFR) gene alteration: FORTUNE study.
indication: advanced solid tumors with fibroblast growth factor receptor (FGFR) gene alteration
mechanism_of_action: selective inhibitor of FGFR1-3 tyrosine kinase
treatment_arm: tasurgratinib 140 mg QD
study_population: patients (pts) with advanced solid tumors harboring FGFR gene alterations
study_size: Registered n=46; full analysis set n=41 (Group A n=10, Group B n=15, Group C n=15, Group D n=1); target enrollment n=10 (Group A), n=15 (Group B), n=15 (Group C), n=1-5 (Group D).

title: Comparative impact of metronomic therapy (methotrexate and celecoxib) and cisplatin-based radiochemotherapy on health-related quality of life in tracheostomized head and neck cancer patients: A comparative analysis.
indication: Tracheostomized patients with metastatic, or advanced head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (H&N SCC).
control_arm: cisplatin-based Radiochemotherapy
treatment_arm: metronomic therapy (methotrexate and Celecoxib)
study_population: Tracheostomized patients aged 18 years or older, diagnosed with metastatic, or advanced head and neck squamous cell carcinoma (H&N SCC). Eligibility criteria required a Karnofsky Performance Score of at least 70.
study_size: A total of 50 patients were enrolled (metronomic: n=25; cisplatin: n=25).

title: In silico evaluation of the interaction of P-gp and 3A4 substrates with the WEE1 inhibitor Debio 0123 and clinical application in the Debio 0123-104 combination trial with carboplatin and etoposide.
indication: SCLC participants that recurred or progressed after previous platinum treatment
mechanism_of_action: highly selective WEE1 kinase inhibitor
treatment_arm: Debio 0123 administered in combination with carboplatin and etoposide
study_population: adult SCLC participants that recurred or progressed after previous platinum treatment
line_of_therapy: recurred or progressed after previous platinum treatment

title: Second interim analysis of CABONEN: An international, multicenter phase II trial investigating cabozantinib in patients with advanced, low proliferative NEN G3.
indication: advanced, low proliferative NEN G3
mechanism_of_action: tyrosine kinase inhibitor
treatment_arm: Cabozantinib
study_population: NEN G3 patients with a Ki67 between 20% and 60%; 26.7% were therapeutically naïve, 28.9% had 1 prior therapy, and 44.4% had 2 or more prior therapeutic lines.
study_size: Planned n=45; enrolled n=45.
line_of_therapy: Mixed lines including treatment-naïve, 1 prior therapy, and 2 or more prior lines

title: Neuro-oncology anywhere: Preliminary results from a decentralized clinical trial aimed at improving neurocognitive outcomes in patients with CNS malignancy.
indication: neurocognitive outcomes in patients with CNS malignancy
mechanism_of_action: targeting radiation-related toxicity
control_arm: health promotion with a wearable device
treatment_arm: health promotion with a wearable device +/- metformin
study_population: patients who have received intracranial radiation for primary and secondary brain tumors
study_size: A total of 54 of 100 planned participants have enrolled (n=27 per arm) as of the data cut-off date of January 27, 2025.
comparator: health promotion with a wearable device
trial_design_and_comparator: randomized vs. health promotion with wearable device

title: Anlotinib versus bevacizumab added to standard first-line chemotherapy among patients with RAS/BRAF wild-type, unresectable metastatic colorectal cancer: A multicenter, prospective, randomised, phase 3 clinical trial (ANCHOR trial).
indication: unresectable metastatic colorectal cancer (mCRC)
mechanism_of_action: oral VEGFR-TKI
control_arm: bevacizumab (7.5mg/kg, IV, day 1), combined with oxaliplatin (130mg/m², IV, day 1) and capecitabine (1000mg/m², BID, days 1-14) in 3-week cycles. After 4-8 induction cycles, maintenance therapy with bevacizumab plus capecitabine continued until progression/unacceptable toxicity.
treatment_arm: anlotinib (12mg, QD, days 1-14) combined with oxaliplatin (130mg/m², IV, day 1) and capecitabine (850mg/m2, BID, days 1-14) in 3-week cycles. After 4-8 induction cycles, maintenance therapy with anlotinib plus capecitabine continued until progression/unacceptable toxicity.
study_population: treatment-naïve RAS/BRAF wild-type mCRC patients with MDT-assessed unresectable metastases
study_size: A total of 748 patients were randomized in the intention-to-treat population (n=373 anlotinib group, n=375 bevacizumab group) with a median follow-up of 25.10 mo.
comparator: bevacizumab added to standard first-line chemotherapy

title: Effect of erythrocyte-antibody conjugates on cancers resistant to checkpoint blockade immunotherapy: A phase I trial.
indication: advanced malignancies resistant to checkpoint blockade therapy
mechanism_of_action: WTX-212 accumulates in the spleen, where it effectively remodels splenic immune landscape by expanding effector T cells and reducing the reservoir of immunosuppressive myeloid cells. These changes further reprogram the tumor microenvironment and suppress tumor growth... PD-1 blockade in the spleen using erythrocyte-antibody conjugates triggers systemic anti-tumor responses
treatment_arm: autologous WTX-212 monotherapy in two dose cohorts (2 × 10¹¹ or 3 × 10¹¹ cells, with 6-10 mg of conjugated antibody)
study_population: heavily treated patients with 11 types of solid tumors, who had received PD-1/PD-L1 antibody-containing regimens as their last line of treatment but developed resistance
study_size: n=14 enrolled patients in two dose cohorts (2 × 10¹¹ or 3 × 10¹¹ cells); data cut-off: January 15, 2025.
line_of_therapy: last line of treatment after resistance to PD-1/PD-L1 antibody-containing regimens

title: A phase 1, multicenter, open-label study of HSK42360, a brain-penetrant BRAF inhibitor, in patients with BRAF V600-mutated solid tumors.
indication: BRAF V600-mutated solid tumors
mechanism_of_action: HSK42360 is a next-generation, small-molecule BRAF paradox breaker with high brain penetration. It displays significantly less paradoxical activation than approved BRAF inhibitors and spares wtBRAF-containing RAF dimers.
treatment_arm: HSK42360 (200-3600 mg/day) monotherapy was given orally.
study_population: adult pts with advanced BRAF V600-mutated solid tumors, including those with recurrent or metastatic solid tumors or primary CNS tumors. Previous BRAF±MEK inhibitor treatment is permitted.
study_size: n=17 treated patients (n=11 efficacy evaluable) across five dose levels as of January 15, 2025.

investigational_product: disitamab vedotin (RC48) in combination with tislelizumab and bevacizumab
title: Phase II study of disitamab vedotin (RC48) in combination with tislelizumab and bevacizumab in patients (Pts) with HER2 alterations locally advanced or metastatic NSCLC: Primary analysis results of RESOLUTION.
indication: locally advanced or metastatic NSCLC harboring HER2 alterations
mechanism_of_action: RC48 is a novel ADC that carries a tubulin inhibitor targeting the HER2 protein, thereby specifically recognizing and killing these cells.
treatment_arm: RC48 (2.0 mg/kg, intravenously, Q3W) combined with Tislelizumab (200mg, intravenously, Q3W) and Bevacizumab (7.5 mg/kg, intravenously, Q3W)
study_population: Pts with locally advanced or metastatic NSCLC harboring HER2 alterations who have not received prior systemic therapy.
study_size: 9 Pts were evaluable for efficacy from April 2024 to January 2025.

title: Alectinib as neoadjuvant treatment in potentially resectable stage III ALK-positive NSCLC: Final analysis of ALNEO phase II trial (GOIRC-01-2020-ML42316).
indication: potentially resectable stage III ALK-positive NSCLC
treatment_arm: neoadjuvant alectinib for 2 cycles (8 weeks) followed by surgery and adjuvant alectinib for 24 cycles (96 weeks)
study_population: Treatment-naïve patients with potentially resectable stage III ALK-positive NSCLC, ECOG PS≤1.
study_size: A total of 33 patients were registered in 20 Italian Oncology Centers, of whom 28 (85%) underwent surgery; median follow-up was 15.2 months.

title: Venetoclax as cytoreductive therapy in high-risk acute promyelocytic leukemia: A potential alternative to anthracyclines.
indication: cytoreductive therapy in high-risk acute promyelocytic leukemia (APL)
treatment_arm: Venetoclax initiated at 100 mg and gradually increased to 400 mg over a week, added to standard ATRA (All-Trans Retinoic Acid) + ATO (Arsenic Trioxide) induction.
study_population: high-risk APL patients unsuitable for anthracycline-based induction therapy (cardiac issues, advanced age and in select patients based on physician discretion)
study_size: Ten patients (n=10) received venetoclax for a median duration of 8 days.

title: Safety, pharmacokinetics (PK), pharmacodynamics (PD), and preliminary efficacy of HLX301, a bispecific antibody targeting PD-L1 and TIGIT, in patients with advanced solid tumors.
indication: advanced solid tumors
mechanism_of_action: bispecific IgG1 antibody targeting PD-L1 and TIGIT
treatment_arm: HLX301 monotherapy at doses of 0.25-15 mg/kg IV Q2W
study_population: patients with locally advanced or metastatic solid tumors who had failed or were intolerant to standard therapy, or for whom no standard therapy was available
study_size: As of Oct 27, 2023, 9 patients were enrolled (0.25 mg/kg, n=3; 1 mg/kg, n=3; 2.5 mg/kg, n=1; 5 mg/kg, n=2), with 8 efficacy-evaluable patients; median duration of treatment was 10.3 weeks.
line_of_therapy: failed or intolerant to standard therapy

title: Neoadjuvant and adjuvant iruplinalkib in resectable ALK or ROS1 fusion-positive, non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC): The preliminary results of the single-arm, exploratory Neo-INFINITY study.
indication: resectable ALK or ROS1 fusion-positive, non-small cell lung cancer (NSCLC)
treatment_arm: Patients received neoadjuvant iruplinalkib orally at 180 mg/day (with a 7-day lead-in at 60 mg/day) for eight weeks, followed by surgery and then adjuvant iruplinalkib (the same dose and lead-in). The total treatment period was up to two years.
study_population: Adult patients with pathologically confirmed resectable ALK- or ROS1-positive NSCLC at stage IB–IIIA or IIIB (T3N2M0 only), ≥one measurable lesion via RECIST v1.1, ECOG performance status of 0 or 1.
study_size: Enrolled n=10, analysis n=8 (including n=6 ALK-positive).

title: Hypothesis generative head-to-head study comparing efficacy of afatinib and osimertinib based on immunological biomarkers in Japanese NSCLC patients with EGFR mutations: Heat on Beat randomized phase II study.
indication: first-line treatment in Japanese NSCLC patients with EGFR mutations
mechanism_of_action: EGFR-TKIs
control_arm: osimertinib (Osi)
treatment_arm: afatinib (Afa)
study_population: Japanese pts with advanced or recurrent EGFR-mutant NSCLC.
study_size: Overall, 95 eligible pts were analyzed (n=47 to Afa and n=48 to Osi) from a planned enrollment of 100 pts (n=50 per arm) at 28 sites in Japan, with a minimum follow-up of 3 years.

title: A phase 2 study of pemigatinib for pre-treated glioblastoma or other gliomas with activating FGFR1-3 alterations: Results from FIGHT-209.
indication: pre-treated glioblastoma or other gliomas with activating FGFR1-3 alterations
mechanism_of_action: Inhibition of FGFR1-3
treatment_arm: Pemigatinib (oral, 13.5 mg on days 1-14/21)
study_population: Adults with FGFR-altered pretreated gliomas (histologically or molecularly defined GBM in cohort A; other gliomas, glioneuronal tumors, and neuronal tumors in cohort B) with tumors harboring a FGFR1-3 fusion/rearrangement or mutation that had recurred/progressed after ≥1 prior therapy.
study_size: A total of 83 patients were enrolled (n=74 in cohort A, n=9 in cohort B) with a data cutoff of September 27, 2024.

title: EGL-121, a first-in-human phase 1/2 trial of EGL-001 in adult patients with selected advanced and/or metastatic solid tumors.
indication: selected advanced and/or metastatic solid tumors
mechanism_of_action: designed to provide checkpoint inhibition by antagonizing the CTLA-4-CD80/86 interaction while selectively depleting intratumoral Tregs by downregulating CD25 and inhibiting IL-2 signaling specifically within these cells.
treatment_arm: Part 1 (Phase 1) dose escalation of EGL-001 administered as a single agent (from 0.3 mg/kg to 12 mg/kg), and in combination with pembrolizumab treatment... Part 2 (Phase 2) dose expansion of EGL-001 administered at the selected doses as monotherapy and/or in combination therapy with anti-PD(L)1.
study_population: adult patients with selected advanced and/or metastatic solid tumors... who have initially benefited (secondary resistance) from an ICI treatment as monotherapy or in combination as SoC as defined by a CR, PR, or SD ≥3 months as best response by RECIST Version 1.1.
study_size: Trial conducted at eight sites in France and Spain; as of January 2025, the first 3 dose escalation cohorts (0.03, 0.1, 0.3 mg/kg) have been completed.
line_of_therapy: Patients with secondary resistance to prior ICI treatment

title: Belantamab treatment of multiple myeloma: Results from part 1 of the first-in-human phase 1/2 DREAMM-20 trial.
indication: relapsed/refractory multiple myeloma (RRMM)
mechanism_of_action: Belantamab (GSK2857914) is the naked BCMA mAb without MMAF
treatment_arm: belantamab 300, 900 or 2000 mg IV Q2W
study_population: patients (pts) with RRMM with ≥3 prior lines of therapy. Median age was 76 y (range, 42-86 y), 17 of 18 pts were triple-class exposed, and 2 of 18 pts had prior BCMA-targeted therapy.
study_size: Total enrolled n=18 across 3 cohorts (n=6 each); data cutoff Aug 23, 2024; median duration of exposure 63.5 days.

title: The combination of naxitamab with or without sintilimab (anti-PD-1) for the treatment of refractory/progressive neuroblastoma: A prospective, non-randomized, multicenter trial.
indication: refractory or progressive neuroblastoma (NB)
mechanism_of_action: Naxitamab, a humanized anti-GD2 monoclonal antibody
control_arm: naxitamab+GM-CSF (n = 6) and naxitamab+GM-CSF+chemotherapy (n = 12)
treatment_arm: naxitamab+GM-CSF+sintilimab (n = 2) and naxitamab+GM-CSF+chemotherapy+sintilimab (n = 14)
study_population: patients with refractory or progressive NB, with a median age of 3.8 years. 5 (14.7%) were diagnosed with MYCN-amplified NB, while 27 (79.4%) presented with non-amplified MYCN. Prior to enrollment, 5 patients had received autologous stem cell transplantation, while 1 patient had undergone allogeneic stem cell transplantation.
study_size: A total of 34 patients were enrolled, with treatment regimens including naxitamab+GM-CSF+sintilimab (n=2), naxitamab+GM-CSF (n=6), naxitamab+GM-CSF+chemotherapy (n=12), and naxitamab+GM-CSF+chemotherapy+sintilimab (n=14); efficacy was evaluable in 25 patients. The median follow-up time was 14.8 mo.
comparator: The study compared outcomes for patients treated with sintilimab versus those without sintilimab within different treatment regimens.

title: Panitumumab retreatment followed by regorafenib versus the reverse sequence in chemorefractory metastatic colorectal cancer patients with RAS and BRAF wild-type circulating tumor DNA (ctDNA): Results of the phase II randomized PARERE trial by GONO.
indication: chemorefractory metastatic colorectal cancer (mCRC) patients with RAS and BRAF wild-type circulating tumor DNA (ctDNA)
mechanism_of_action: anti-EGFR monoclonal antibodies
control_arm: regorafenib (rego) followed by panitumumab (pani) after progression (arm B)
treatment_arm: panitumumab (pani) followed by regorafenib (rego) after progression (arm A)
study_population: chemorefractory RAS and BRAF wild-type (wt) metastatic colorectal cancer (mCRC) pts, who previously derived benefit from first-line anti-EGFR-containing regimens, then received at least one intervening anti-EGFR-free line of treatment, and were prospectively selected for the absence of RAS and BRAF mutations in their ctDNA.
study_size: 428 pts screened, 213 randomized (arm A n=106, arm B n=107) from 37 Italian centers; analysis sets for 2nd progression included n=75 (arm A) and n=70 (arm B), and per protocol population n=68/69 (A/B); median follow-up 23.5 mo.

title: An exploratory clinical study investigating the neoadjuvant treatment of HER2-low expressing, stage II-III breast cancer with disitamab vedotin combined with penpulimab (RCVDBCIIR005).
indication: neoadjuvant treatment for HER2-low early or locally advanced breast cancer
mechanism_of_action: Disitamab Vedotin, a novel HER2-targeted antibody-drug conjugate (ADC), and Penpulimab, an anti-PD-1 monoclonal antibody
treatment_arm: Disitamab Vedotin (2.0 mg/kg IV) and Penpulimab (200 mg IV) every 3 weeks for a total of 6 cycles, followed by surgery.
study_population: patients with newly diagnosed HER2-low expressing (IHC 1+ or 2+ without amplification by FISH), stage II-III breast cancer
study_size: A total of 20 patients were enrolled, with an analysis set of n=16.

title: A phase II study of lenvatinib plus pembrolizumab in patients with recurrent/metastatic salivary gland cancers.
indication: recurrent/metastatic (R/M) salivary gland cancers (SGCs) (non-ACC histologies)
mechanism_of_action: Based on the hypothesis that VEGFR inhibition can enhance immune checkpoint-induced responses against SGCs, we conducted a phase II trial of the multikinase inhibitor lenvatinib (len) plus the programmed death-1 (PD-1) inhibitor pembrolizumab (pem)
treatment_arm: Len 20 mg oral daily and pem 200 mg intravenously every 3 weeks
study_population: Patients (Pts) with R/M SGC (except ACC) were enrolled. RECIST v1.1 measurable disease was required; prior therapies were allowed. Pts with acinic cell carcinoma (AcCC) were required to have progression of disease (PD) or worsening disease-related symptoms.
study_size: A total of 27 patients were enrolled, with 26 evaluable for study endpoints, as of the data cut-off on 1/20/25.

title: A phase Ib/II trial of radiotherapy combined with doxorubicin and PD-1 antibody for localized high-risk limbs and trunk soft tissue sarcomas.
indication: localized high-risk limbs and trunk soft tissue sarcomas
mechanism_of_action: PD-1 antibody
treatment_arm: Participants will receive RT (BED = 50-60 Gy), combined with DOXO and PD-1 antibody (Sintilimab, SIN 200 mg, Day 1) every three weeks for four cycles prior to surgery. In Phase Ib (3+3 design), patients will receive Pegylated liposomal doxorubicin (PLD, 37.5 mg/m² or 30 mg/m², i.v., Day 1). In Phase II, DOXO will be administered as PLD at RP2D or as Doxorubicin Hydrochloride (Adriamycin, ADM, 75 mg/m² i.v., Day 1).
study_population: patients with localized high-risk STSs
study_size: A total of 33 of a planned 52 patients were enrolled, with 28 radiologically evaluable and 24 pathologically assessable.

title: A phase 1 study of abemaciclib and niraparib as neoadjuvant therapy in hormone receptor positive and HER2 negative breast cancer.
indication: neoadjuvant therapy in hormone receptor positive and HER2 negative breast cancer
mechanism_of_action: Abemaciclib is a cyclin dependent kinase 4/6 inhibitor... Niraparib is a poly-ADP-ribose polymerase inhibitor (PARPi)... In preclinical data, treatment with abemaciclib sensitizes tumors to DNA damaging agents such as PARPi.
treatment_arm: dose level 1 (DL1) consisting of abemaciclib 150 mg PO BID and niraparib 100 mg PO daily, and DL2 of abemaciclib 150 mg PO BID and niraparib 200 mg PO daily
study_population: Pts aged ≥18 years with biopsy-proven stage I-III HRBC (ER ≥1%, PR ≥1%, HER2 non-amplified) planned for NAT were eligible for this study.
study_size: A total of n=8 pts were enrolled (n=3 at DL1), with n=5 completing 2 cycles for disease evaluation; median follow-up was 3 years.

title: Neoadjuvant chemotherapy with gemcitabine plus cisplatin followed by radical liver resection versus immediate radical liver resection alone followed adjuvant therapy in biliary tract cancer: Final results from the phase III AIO/CALGP/ACO-GAIN-Trial.
indication: Biliary Tract Cancer (BTC) and (incidental) Gallbladder Carcinoma ((I)GBC)
control_arm: direct surgery followed by adjuvant treatment according to investigators choice (Arm B)
treatment_arm: neoadjuvant (perioperative) systemic chemotherapy (Gemcitabine + Cisplatin 3 cycles pre- and post-surgery) followed by radical surgery (Arm A)
study_population: patients (pts) with localized or locally advanced resectable non metastatic biliary tract cancer (intra-/extrahepatic cholangiocarcinoma ICC/ECC; GBC in front of radical liver resection)
study_size: Randomized n=68 (ITT Arm A n=32, ITT Arm B n=30); median follow-up 11.8 mo.
comparator: direct surgery followed by adjuvant treatment

title: Prophylactic infusion of allogeneic double-negative T cells as immune modulators to prevent relapse in high-risk AML patients after allo-HSCT: A phase I trial.
indication: preventing relapse in high-risk AML patients after allo-HSCT
mechanism_of_action: The dual ability of DNTs to suppress GvHD while preserving the graft-versus-leukemia effect
treatment_arm: Two dosage groups: 1×10^8 DNTs/kg and 1.5×10^8 DNTs/kg. Each patient received three infusions at one-month intervals without prior lymphodepleting chemotherapy.
study_population: Six high-risk AML patients undergoing allo-HSCT were enrolled.
study_size: Six high-risk AML patients were enrolled (n=6) and assigned to two dosage groups; data cutoff was January 20, 2025, with a median follow-up of 17.55 mo post-HSCT.

title: Comparable efficacy of venetoclax 50mg with posaconazole versus venetoclax 400mg in newly diagnosed AML patients: A prospective study of pharmacokinetics, toxicity, and clinical outcomes.
indication: newly diagnosed AML patients unfit for intensive chemotherapy
control_arm: VEN 400 mg without posaconazole
treatment_arm: VEN 50 mg with posaconazole
study_population: 31 AML patients unfit for intensive chemotherapy.
study_size: Total enrolled n=31 (VEN50 cohort, n=20; VEN400 cohort, n=11).

title: A multicenter, randomized, controlled, open-label trial to determine the optimal duration of steroid therapy for mild pneumonitis associated with immune checkpoint inhibitors.
indication: mild pneumonitis associated with immune checkpoint inhibitors
control_arm: 6-week corticosteroid treatment
treatment_arm: 3-week corticosteroid treatment
study_population: Patients with mild immune-related pneumonitis (grade 1 or 2), with a median age of 72 years, 81% men, and 73% with grade 2 pneumonitis at baseline.
study_size: A total of n=106 patients were randomized, with n=105 in the ITT population (n=51 in the 3-week group, n=54 in the 6-week group) from 22 institutions in Japan.

title: Phase 1 study of LB1410, a bivalent TIM-3/PD-1 bispecific antibody, in patients with advanced solid tumors or lymphoma.
indication: advanced solid tumors or lymphoma
mechanism_of_action: recombinant humanized anti-PD-1/TIM-3 bispecific antibody (BsAb)
treatment_arm: LB1410 at dose cohorts ranging from 0.001 mg/kg to 20 mg/kg IV Q2W.
study_population: Eligible patients were ≥18 years old with ECOG PS 0-1 and advanced solid tumors; 76.9% of enrolled patients had solid tumors that had failed standard therapies and were resistant or refractory to anti-PD-1/PD-L1 treatments.
study_size: Total enrolled n=79; response-evaluable n=66; data cut-off January 15, 2025.
line_of_therapy: resistant or refractory to anti-PD-1/PD-L1 treatments

title: A phase II trial of pembrolizumab and lenvatinib in recurrent or persistent clear cell ovarian carcinoma (NCT05296512).
modality: PD-1 inhibitor, anti-angiogenic tyrosine kinase inhibitor
indication: recurrent or persistent clear cell ovarian carcinoma (CCOC)
mechanism_of_action: the combination of the PD-1 inhibitor pembrolizumab with the anti-angiogenic tyrosine kinase inhibitor lenvatinib
treatment_arm: pembrolizumab 200 mg IV every 3 weeks and lenvatinib 20 mg daily
study_population: Pts with clear cell ovarian carcinoma (CCOC) and measurable disease who could have received an unlimited number of prior therapies; prior bevacizumab and immune checkpoint inhibitors were allowed, but prior lenvatinib was exclusionary. Malignant bowel involvement was not allowed.
study_size: Enrolled n=30 (stage 1 n=18, stage 2 n=13); data cut-off 22-Oct-2024; median follow-up 9.72 mo.

title: EVEREST-2: Initial data of the logic-gated Tmod chimeric antigen receptor T-cell (CAR T) therapy A2B694 for patients with solid tumors associated with mesothelin (MSLN) expression and with human leukocyte antigen (HLA) loss of heterozygosity (LOH).
indication: solid tumors associated with mesothelin (MSLN) expression and with human leukocyte antigen (HLA) loss of heterozygosity (LOH)
mechanism_of_action: an autologous, logic-gated Tmod CAR T therapy targeted to MSLN, which is normally expressed in the mesothelium and can be upregulated in many solid tumors. A2B694 is designed to overcome challenges of on-target, off-tumor toxicity that have limited other MSLN-targeted approaches by combining a CAR-activating receptor targeting MSLN with a blocker CAR that recognizes HLA-A*02, to distinguish between normal and tumor cells
treatment_arm: A2B694 infusion following lymphodepletion. Dose escalation started at 1x10^8 Tmod positive cells (DL 1) and will increase up to 14x10^8 in combination with low-dose IL-2 (DL 5).
study_population: Adults with recurrent unresectable, locally advanced, or metastatic cancers with MSLN expression who have progressed after standard-of-care therapy, with enrolled participants having ovarian cancer, pancreatic cancer, or non-small cell lung cancer and a median of 4 prior lines of therapy.
study_size: Enrolled n=5, efficacy evaluable n=5; data cut-off Jan 15, 2025; follow-up up to 7.5 mo.

title: A phase I study of allogeneic anti-CD19 CAR-T therapy for patients with CD19+ relapsed/refractory acute B-lymphoblastic leukemia.
indication: CD19+ relapsed/refractory acute B-lymphoblastic leukemia (R/R B-ALL)
mechanism_of_action: an allogeneic CAR-T product engineered with TCR/Gene-X knockout and NK inhibitory molecule overexpression, exhibiting resistance to allogeneic rejection and enhanced anti-tumor effects without inducing graft-versus-host disease (GvHD).
treatment_arm: RD06-03 at dose levels (CAR+ T cells/kg) of DL1: 1×10^5, DL2: 3×10^5, DL3: 5×10^5 and EDL (exploratory dose level): 6.5×10^5, following lymphodepletion with fludarabine (30mg/m^2/day) and cyclophosphamide (500mg/m^2/day) for 3 days before CAR-T infusion.
study_population: Patients aged 3-70 years with CD19+ R/R B-ALL.
study_size: Total enrolled n=6 (DL1: n=1, DL2: n=3, DL3: n=1, EDL: n=1) as of data cut-off December 15, 2024, with a median follow-up of 128 days.

title: Phase 3 AMPLITUDE trial: Niraparib (NIRA) and abiraterone acetate plus prednisone (AAP) for metastatic castration-sensitive prostate cancer (mCSPC) patients (pts) with alterations in homologous recombination repair (HRR) genes.
indication: metastatic castration-sensitive prostate cancer (mCSPC) patients (pts) with alterations in homologous recombination repair (HRR) genes
mechanism_of_action: highly selective and potent inhibitor of poly (ADP-ribose) polymerase (PARP)-1/2
control_arm: PBO + AAP (placebo plus abiraterone acetate 1000 mg plus prednisone 5 mg)
treatment_arm: dual-action tablet (NIRA 200 mg + abiraterone acetate 1000 mg) plus prednisone 5 mg
study_population: Pts with germline or somatic HRR gene alterations (BRCA1, BRCA2, BRIP1, CDK12, CHEK2, FANCA, PALB2, RAD51B, RAD54L) with metastatic castration-sensitive prostate cancer (mCSPC) who had received ≤6 mo of androgen deprivation therapy (ADT) ± ≤6 cycles of docetaxel (DOC) ± ≤45 d of AAP with metastatic disease extended beyond lymph nodes.
study_size: A total of 696 pts were randomized to NIRA + AAP (n=348) or AAP (n=348); median follow-up is 30.8 mo; data cutoff was 7 Jan 2025.
comparator: PBO + AAP (placebo plus abiraterone acetate plus prednisone)
trial_design_and_comparator: randomized vs abiraterone acetate plus prednisone

title: Efficacy and safety of Gegen Qinlian tablets in attenuating immune-related adverse events in NSCLC patients: A randomized controlled, multicenter, open-label trial in China.
indication: Attenuating immune-related adverse events (irAEs) in non-small-cell lung cancer (NSCLC) patients treated with immune checkpoint inhibitors (ICIs).
mechanism_of_action: GQT might attenuate irAEs significantly and prolong the median onset time of irAEs by regulating the gut microflora and metabolites.
control_arm: ICI and chemotherapy
treatment_arm: ICI and chemotherapy plus Gegen Qinlian Tablets
study_population: eligible patients with NSCLC at the first-line therapy
study_size: A total of 94 patients were enrolled and randomized (1:1) to the GQT group (n=47) or the control group (n=47); response-evaluable patients were n=45 in the GQT group and n=43 in the control group.

title: Prospective randomized phase II trial to assess the efficacy and safety of neo-adjuvant olaparib/carboplatin (OC) in comparison to docetaxel/epirubicin/cyclophosphamide (TAC) in patients with early triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) with homologous recombination deficiency (HRD): Primary results from the ABCSG 45 trial.
indication: neo-adjuvant treatment in patients with early triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC) with homologous recombination deficiency (HRD)
control_arm: 6 cycles of docetaxel/epirubicin/cyclophosphamide (75/50/500) q3w (TAC)
treatment_arm: 6 cycles of olaparib (100 mg bid, days 4-16) / carboplatin (AUC 5) q3w
study_population: Pts with HRD (Myriad genetics)-positive eTNBC
study_size: Planned sample size was 90 pts; a total of 90 pts were randomized (OC: n=46; TAC: n=44) between November 2019 and December 2023.

title: First-line serplulimab and bevacizumab combined with nab-paclitaxel/gemcitabine followed by mFOLFOX in advanced pancreatic cancer: A phase II trial.
indication: unresectable locally advanced or metastatic pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma
mechanism_of_action: serplulimab (anti-PD-1) and HLX04 (a bevacizumab biosimilar)
treatment_arm: serplulimab (anti-PD-1) and HLX04 (a bevacizumab biosimilar) combined with nab-paclitaxel plus gemcitabine (nab-P/Gem), followed by modified FOLFOX (oxaliplatin, leucovorin, and 5-fluorouracil; mFOLFOX)
study_population: patients with histologically or cytologically confirmed unresectable locally advanced or metastatic pancreatic ductal adenocarcinoma
study_size: Enrolled n=37, analyzed n=37; data cutoff November 2024, median follow-up 6.1 mo.

title: A phase II study of the interleukin-6 (IL-6) receptor blocking antibody sarilumab (Sari) in combination with ipilimumab (Ipi), nivolumab (Nivo) and relatlimab (Rela) in patients with unresectable stage III or stage IV melanoma.
indication: unresectable stage III or stage IV melanoma
mechanism_of_action: interleukin-6 (IL-6) receptor blocking antibody
treatment_arm: Nivo/Rela 480 mg/160 mg Q4W, Ipi 1 mg/kg Q8W and Sari 200mg q2 weeks for 12 doses over 24 weeks followed by maintenance Nivo/Rela 480 mg/160 mg Q4W and Ipi 1 mg/kg Q8W.
study_population: patients with unresectable stage III or stage IV melanoma; prior adjuvant immunotherapy was allowed if > 6 months before enrollment and patients with controlled brain metastases could enroll.
study_size: n=33 treated; data cut-off 12/12/24; median follow-up 9.8 mo.

title: A phase II, open-label study to improve compliance and time of treatment after obtaining complete response (CR) through a tailored schedule of sonidegib in locally advanced basal cell carcinomas (laBCC): The SONIBEC trial.
indication: maintenance treatment for locally advanced basal cell carcinomas (laBCC) after achieving complete response (CR).
treatment_arm: Eligible pts received tailored schedule 1 (TS1) with sonidegib 14 days on and 14 days off. Pts on TS1 who experienced grade 2-3 toxicity (except alopecia) lasting >28 days moved to TS2 (7 days on and 21 days off).
study_population: adult patients (pts) with locally advanced basal cell carcinomas (laBCC) who obtained a complete response (CR) to sonidegib regardless of the tumor’s subtype and burden.
study_size: Enrolled n=22 from 10 Italian centers; evaluable n=19; data cut-off was Jan 2025; median follow-up was 22 mo.

title: Pertuzumab plus trastuzumab (P+T) in patients (pts) with bladder (BC) and ovarian cancer (OC) with ERBB2/3 alterations (alt): Results from the Targeted Agent and Profiling Utilization Registry (TAPUR) study.
indication: bladder (BC) and ovarian cancer (OC) with ERBB2/3 alterations (alt)
treatment_arm: Pertuzumab at an initial dose of 840 mg intravenously (IV), then 420 mg IV every 3 weeks and Trastuzumab at an initial dose of 8 mg/kg IV, then 6 mg/kg IV every 3 weeks until disease progression.
study_population: Eligible patients had measurable disease, ECOG performance status (PS) 0-2, adequate organ function, and no standard treatment options, with bladder (BC) or ovarian cancer (OC) with ERBB2/3 alterations.
study_size: 28 patients were enrolled in the bladder cancer cohort (N=28) and 28 patients were enrolled in the ovarian cancer cohort (N=28).
line_of_therapy: advanced cancers with no standard treatment options

title: Phase II safety and preliminary efficacy of amulirafusp alfa (IMM0306) in combination with lenalidomide in patients with relapsed or refractory CD20-positive follicular lymphoma.
indication: relapsed or refractory CD20-positive follicular lymphoma (FL)
mechanism_of_action: Amulirafusp alfa (IMM0306) consists of anti-CD20 monoclonal antibody fused with the CD47 binding domain of SIRPα. It exerts potent anti-cancer efficacy by activating both macrophages and NK cells via blockading of CD47-SIRPα interaction and FcɣR engagement.
treatment_arm: amulirafusp alfa 1.6 mg/kg intravenously once a week with lenalidomide 20 mg orally once a day on Days 1 to 21 in each 28-day cycle
study_population: Eligible patients with grade 1-3a relapsed or refractory (R/R) CD20-positive follicular lymphoma (FL) who had received previous anti-CD20 therapy, with a median of 2 prior lines of therapy.
study_size: Enrolled n=34; efficacy-evaluable n=22; data cut-off: Dec 26, 2024.

title: An open label randomized non-inferiority trial comparing adjuvant platinum plus paclitaxel to platinum plus 5-FU after curative resection in high-risk penile carcinoma.
indication: adjuvant therapy in high-risk penile cancer
control_arm: 4 cycles of platinum plus 5-FU (PF arm)
treatment_arm: 4 cycles of platinum plus paclitaxel (PP arm)
study_population: Patients with high-risk penile cancer [> 1 inguinal lymph node (LN), perinodal extension, pelvic LN, or LN > 4 cm] who underwent curative resection
study_size: A total of 49 patients were randomized (n=25 to PF arm; n=24 to PP arm) with a median follow-up of 60.1 mo.

title: Palbociclib in patients (pts) with ovarian cancer (OC) with CDKN2A alterations: Results from the Targeted Agent and Profiling Utilization Registry (TAPUR) study.
indication: ovarian cancer (OC) with CDKN2A alterations
mechanism_of_action: oral cyclin-dependent kinase 4/6 inhibitor
treatment_arm: Palbociclib dosing was one 125 mg capsule taken orally once daily for 21 days followed by 7 days off, until disease progression.
study_population: Patients with advanced ovarian cancer (OC) with CDKN2A alterations, measurable disease, ECOG performance status (PS) 0-2, adequate organ function, no standard treatment options, and tumors without mutations in the RB gene.
study_size: A total of n=28 patients with ovarian cancer were enrolled.

title: Phase IB and II study of ribociclib with trastuzumab plus endocrine therapy in HR+/HER2+ advanced breast cancer patients: Korean Cancer Study Group BR 18-2 MINI trial.
indication: HR+/HER2+ advanced breast cancer
mechanism_of_action: CDK4/6 inhibitors
treatment_arm: ribociclib (RPIID: 600 mg QD) with fixed doses of letrozole (2.5 mg QD) and trastuzumab (8 mg/kg loading, then 6 mg/kg every 3 weeks)
study_population: Eligible patients were HR+/HER2+ ABC with no prior systemic therapy for metastatic disease.
study_size: Phase IB (n=13) and Phase II (n=77) were conducted across 17 academic institutions in South Korea, with a median follow-up of 15.8 mo.

title: Neoadjuvant cadonilimab (anti-PD-1/CTLA-4 bispecific antibody) plus chemotherapy in early or locally advanced triple-negative breast cancer: A single-arm phase II trial (CABIN study).
indication: Neoadjuvant treatment for stage IA-IIIC triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC).
mechanism_of_action: bispecific PD-1/CTLA-4 antibody
treatment_arm: cadonilimab (10 mg/kg) plus nab-paclitaxel (260 mg/m²) and carboplatin (AUC 4) every 3 weeks for six cycles
study_population: patients aged 18-75 with treatment-naïve, stage IA-IIIC triple-negative breast cancer (TNBC)
study_size: A total of 29 patients were enrolled.

title: Alectinib in children and adolescents with solid or CNS tumors harboring ALK-fusions: A data update from the iMATRIX alectinib phase I/II open-label, multi-center study.
indication: Children and adolescents with solid or CNS tumors harboring ALK-fusions.
mechanism_of_action: next generation oral inhibitor of ALK-fusion proteins
treatment_arm: Alectinib
study_population: Patients, less than 18 years of age, with ALK fusion-positive solid or CNS tumors for whom prior treatment had proven to be ineffective or for whom there was no satisfactory treatment available.
study_size: Total enrolled n=22; safety evaluable n=21; efficacy evaluable n=16; data cut-off July 2024.
line_of_therapy: Prior treatment ineffective or no satisfactory treatment available; includes first-line (14/22 patients had not received prior systemic therapy).

title: Osimertinib plus anlotinib in patients with untreated, EGFR-mutated, advanced non-small-cell lung cancer with concurrent gene alterations: A single-arm, prospective, multicenter phase II study.
indication: untreated, EGFR-mutated, advanced non-small-cell lung cancer with concurrent gene alterations
mechanism_of_action: EGFR tyrosine kinase inhibitors (EGFR-TKIs)
treatment_arm: oral Osimertinib (80 mg daily) and Anlotinib (10 mg daily for 2 weeks, followed by 1 week off), repeated every 3 weeks
study_population: patients (pts) with untreated, advanced NSCLC carrying EGFR exon 19 deletions or L858R mutations plus at least one additional mutation in TP53, PI3KCA, or RB1
study_size: Enrolled n=38 as of data cut-off on June 24, 2024, with a median follow-up of 14.5 mo.

title: Phase II assessment of carboplatin with etoposide and high-dose ifosfamide in rEECur, an international randomised controlled trial of chemotherapy for the treatment of recurrent and primary refractory Ewing sarcoma (RR-ES).
indication: recurrent and primary refractory Ewing sarcoma (RR-ES)
control_arm: IFOS 15 g/m2 by continuous intravenous (IV) infusion over 5 days
treatment_arm: IV carboplatin 400 mg/m2 day 1 and etoposide 120 mg/m2 days 1 to 3 (CE)
study_population: Patients aged at least 2 years with recurrent and primary refractory Ewing sarcoma (RR-ES), including those with refractory disease (14%), 1st recurrence (81%), or > 1st recurrence (6%).
study_size: A total of 139 patients were randomized 1:1 to IFOS (n=69) or CE (n=70), with a median follow-up of 18 mos.

title: Phase I/II study of the EP4 antagonist vorbipiprant combined with anti-PD-1 immunotherapy: Safety and efficacy results in metastatic gastrointestinal non-colorectal cancers.
indication: metastatic non-colorectal GI cancers
mechanism_of_action: EP4 antagonist
treatment_arm: oral vorbipiprant (90 mg twice daily) plus iv balstilimab (3 mg/kg every 2 weeks)
study_population: Twenty-seven adult patients (pts) with metastatic non-colorectal GI cancers, ECOG PS ≤1, and ≥1 prior treatment line were included in 3 cohorts (9 pts each): gastric cancer (GC) with PD-L1 Combined Positive Score (CPS) ≥5 (cohort A), GC with PD-L1 CPS < 5 (cohort B), and GI cancers other than CRC and GC (cohort C).
study_size: Enrolment of 27 patients is completed (n=9 in each of 3 cohorts); data cut-off was November 20, 2024.

title: Becotatug vedotin vs. chemotherapy in pre-heavily treated advanced nasopharyngeal carcinoma: A randomized, controlled, multicenter, open-label study.
indication: heavily pretreated R/M NPC
mechanism_of_action: novel EGFR-targeted antibody-drug conjugate
control_arm: chemotherapy (capecitabine 1000 mg/m2, po, twice daily, d1-14, Q3W; or docetaxel 75 mg/m2, iv, d1, Q3W)
treatment_arm: MRG003 (2.3 mg/kg, d1, iv, Q3W)
study_population: Eligible pts with R/M NPC had failed ≥2 lines of systemic chemotherapy and PD-(L)1 inhibitor, and were randomized to receive MRG003 (2.3 mg/kg, d1, iv, Q3W) or chemotherapy (capecitabine 1000 mg/m2, po, twice daily, d1-14, Q3W; or docetaxel 75 mg/m2, iv, d1, Q3W). Randomization was stratified according to liver metastasis (yes or no) and ECOG PS (0 or 1).
study_size: A total of 173 pts were randomly assigned to MRG003 (n=86) or chemotherapy (n=87); data cutoff 30 June 2024 (ORR/PFS) and 30 December 2024 (OS); median follow-up 13.5 mo (MRG003) and 13.6 mo (chemotherapy).
line_of_therapy: failed ≥2 lines of systemic chemotherapy and PD-(L)1 inhibitor

title: Final clinical and molecular analysis of the EORTC randomized phase III intergroup CATNON trial on concurrent and adjuvant temozolomide in anaplastic glioma without 1p/19q codeletion: NCT00626990.
indication: newly diagnosed non-codeleted anaplastic glioma
control_arm: 59.4 Gy radiotherapy (RT) alone
treatment_arm: The 2x2 factorial design included three arms with temozolomide (TMZ): 59.4 Gy radiotherapy (RT) with concurrent TMZ; RT with 12 cycles of adjuvant TMZ; or RT with both concurrent and adjuvant TMZ.
study_population: adult patients with newly diagnosed non-codeleted anaplastic glioma
study_size: Randomized n=751; intent-to-treat population with 499 events observed; IDH status determined in n=660 patients (IDHmt n=444, IDHwt n=216); median follow-up 10.9 years.

title: Hypoxia-responsive CEA CAR-T cells therapy for relapsed or refractory non-small cell lung cancer: A single-arm, open-label, phase I trial.
indication: relapsed or refractory non-small cell lung cancer (r/r NSCLC)
mechanism_of_action: Chimeric antigen receptor (CAR)-T cell therapy has achieved significant success in targeted tumor cells eradication.
treatment_arm: intravenous CEA CAR-T cells at three dose levels (0.75×10^6, 1.5×10^6, and 3×10^6 CEA CAR-T cells/kg)
study_population: Adult metastatic NSCLC patients with relapse after ≥2 lines of treatment.
study_size: 18 patients were screened, 15 received CAR-T infusion across three dose levels (dose level 1 n=3, dose level 2 n=6, dose level 3 n=6), with a median follow-up of 5.7 mo.

title: A randomized controlled study of tislelizumab combined with concurrent chemoradiotherapy in the treatment of locally advanced cervical cancer and the predictive value of T lymphocyte subsets for efficacy.
indication: locally advanced cervical cancer (LACC)
control_arm: Concurrent chemoradiotherapy (CCRT) consisting of single-agent cisplatin at a dose of 40 mg/m2 and external irradiation using 6MV-X-ray intensity-modulated radiotherapy with a dose of 45-50Gy/25f.
treatment_arm: 200 mg of tislelizumab intravenously infused on the first day of radiotherapy, once every 3 weeks, for 1 year, combined with concurrent chemoradiotherapy (CCRT).
study_population: patients with LACC [locally advanced cervical cancer]
study_size: A total of 53 patients were randomized to the CCRT group (n=26) or the CCRT+T group (n=27); data cutoff was January 2025, with a median follow-up of 13.7 mo in the CCRT group and 11.2 mo in the CCRT+T group.

title: Efficacy and safety of STUPP regimen with or without anlotinib for newly diagnosed glioblastoma: Results of a multicenter, double-blind, randomized phase II trial.
indication: newly diagnosed glioblastoma (GBM)
mechanism_of_action: a multi-kinase inhibitor targeting tumor angiogenesis and proliferation
control_arm: placebo alongside TMZ-based chemoradiotherapy (54–60 Gy). Patients undergo six TMZ cycles and eight placebo cycles after radiotherapy, then receiving placebo until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.
treatment_arm: anlotinib (10 mg/day, days 1–14 per 21-day cycle) alongside TMZ-based chemoradiotherapy (54–60 Gy). Patients undergo six TMZ cycles and eight anlotinib cycles after radiotherapy, then receiving anlotinib until disease progression or unacceptable toxicity.
study_population: Eligible patients (≥18 years, ECOG ≤2) with newly diagnosed glioblastoma, excluding those with brainstem-only tumors, prior GBM therapy, IDH1/2 mutations, or significant intracranial hemorrhage.
study_size: A total of 153 patients were randomized (n=77 anlotinib, n=76 placebo) out of a planned 150 patients; median follow-up was 27.53 mo in the anlotinib group and 31.05 mo in the placebo group.

investigational_product: pembrolizumab in combination with dabrafenib and trametinib (DTP)
title: Neoadjuvant pembrolizumab in combination with dabrafenib and trametinib (DTP) for BRAF V600E-mutated anaplastic thyroid cancer ( BRAF m-ATC): A multicenter phase 2 trial.
indication: BRAF V600E-mutated anaplastic thyroid cancer (BRAF m-ATC)
treatment_arm: Following a 3-6 week run-in with dabrafenib (150 mg BID) and trametinib (2 mg daily), pembrolizumab (200 mg Q3W) was added. Post-operatively, patients continued pembrolizumab (or DTP) with radiotherapy or transitioned directly to adjuvant DTP (up to 26 cycles).
study_population: patients with BRAFm-ATC stage IVB/IVC
study_size: Enrolled n=42, analysis set n=36, from 5 US centers, with a median follow-up of 18 mo.

title: JMT101 in combination with irinotecan and SG001 versus regorafenib in patients with metastatic colorectal adenocarcinoma (mCRC): Results of a randomized, controlled, open-label, phase II study.
indication: metastatic colorectal adenocarcinoma (mCRC)
mechanism_of_action: humanized IgG1 anti-EGFR monoclonal antibody [mAb]
control_arm: regorafenib 160mg QD, days 1-21 of 28-day cycles
treatment_arm: Arm A: JMT101 6 mg/kg + irinotecan 180 mg/m2 + SG001 240 mg Q2W; Arm B: JMT101 + irinotecan
study_population: Patients with histologically or cytologically confirmed RAS/BRAF wild-type mCRC without MSI-H/dMMR, who had progressed after ≥ 2 prior systemic therapies.
study_size: A safety run-in (n=3) was followed by randomization of 106 patients (Arm A n=36, Arm B n=35, Arm C n=35), with 34, 35, and 34 efficacy-evaluable patients in Arms A, B, and C, respectively; data cut-off was Jan 24, 2025, with a median follow-up of 7.4 mo.

title: A phase Ia/Ib study of talazoparib in combination with tazemetostat in metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC).
indication: metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC)
mechanism_of_action: In pre-clinical studies, EZH2 directly regulates DNA damage repair (DDR) gene expression, and inhibition of EZH2 sensitizes prostate cancer cells to genotoxic stress as induced by poly-ADP ribose polymerase (PARP) inhibition.
treatment_arm: The recommended phase 2 dose (RP2D) was talazoparib 0.75 mg daily and tazemetostat 800 mg BID. Other dose levels tested included talazoparib 0.75 mg QD + tazemetostat 600 mg BID (DL 0) and talazoparib 1 mg QD + tazemetostat 800 mg BID (DL +2).
study_population: Eligible patients (pts) with metastatic castration-resistant prostate cancer (mCRPC) had progressive disease after at least one secondary hormonal therapy and taxane-based chemotherapy, disease evaluable for response (PSA ≥ 2 ng/ml or measurable disease by RECIST 1.1) and a metastatic lesion amenable to biopsy.
study_size: Phase 1a (n=12) and Phase 1b (n=20) were conducted; 27 pts were treated at the RP2D, with 11 DLT-evaluable, 23 PSA-evaluable, and 12 with measurable disease.
line_of_therapy: progressive disease after at least one secondary hormonal therapy and taxane-based chemotherapy

title: Phase III randomized placebo-controlled trial on repurposing olanzapine for prevention of radiotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting (RINV): CTRI/2022/01/039723.
indication: prevention of radiotherapy-induced nausea and vomiting (RINV) in abdominal-pelvic radiation therapy patients
control_arm: matching placebo daily, along with standard care (ondansetron 4mg twice daily)
treatment_arm: 5mg olanzapine daily, along with standard care (ondansetron 4mg twice daily)
study_population: patients undergoing radiotherapy (RT) [Eligibility: >18 yrs, abdominal/pelvic RT, no prior RT history]
study_size: Screened n=683, randomized n=301 (placebo n=153, experimental/olanzapine n=148).

title: Romiplostim for chemotherapy-induced thrombocytopenia (CIT) in colorectal, gastroesophageal, and pancreatic cancers: A global, phase 3, randomized, placebo-controlled trial (RCT).
indication: chemotherapy-induced thrombocytopenia (CIT) in colorectal, gastroesophageal, and pancreatic cancers
mechanism_of_action: thrombopoietin receptor agonist
control_arm: placebo (PBO) for 3 chemotherapy cycles
treatment_arm: romiplostim (ROMI) for 3 chemotherapy cycles, started at 2 μg/kg subcutaneous weekly, adjusted weekly by 1 μg/kg up to 10 μg/kg to target Plt ≥100×10^9/L
study_population: patients receiving oxaliplatin-based multiagent regimens for GI cancers with persistent CIT, ie platelets (Plt) ≤85×10^9/L on day 1 of a scheduled chemotherapy cycle
study_size: Randomized N=165 (n=109 ROMI, n=56 PBO) from 55 sites in 14 countries.

title: Five-year follow-up results from the phase 3 KEYNOTE-564 study of adjuvant pembrolizumab (pembro) for the treatment of clear cell renal cell carcinoma (ccRCC).
indication: adjuvant treatment of clear cell renal cell carcinoma (ccRCC) at increased risk of recurrence
control_arm: pbo IV Q3W for ~1 yr (17 cycles)
treatment_arm: pembro 200 mg IV Q3W for ~1 yr (17 cycles)
study_population: Adults with ccRCC with intermediate-high (pT2 Gr 4 or sarcomatoid, or pT3 any Gr, N0 M0) or high (pT4 any Gr, N0 M0, or any pT and Gr, N+ M0) risk of recurrence or M1 with no evidence of disease (NED) who had nephrectomy and/or metastasectomy ≤12 wks prior to randomization.
study_size: A total of 994 pts were randomized to pembro (n=496) or pbo (n=498); data cutoff was 25 Sept 2024 with a median follow-up of 69.5 mo.

title: A phase 1 study of B7H3 CAR-T cells administered intracranially in recurrent glioblastoma.
indication: recurrent glioblastoma (GBM)
mechanism_of_action: chimeric antigen receptor T cells targeting B7H3 (B7H3-CART)
treatment_arm: B7H3-CART was administered via intratumoral and intraventricular Ommaya reservoirs monthly for a planned 6 months or until confirmed disease progression. Dose escalation followed a 3+3 design with a recommended phase 2 dose established at 25x10^6 cells.
study_population: patients with recurrent GBM undergoing repeat resection
study_size: Enrolled n=11 (all had cells manufactured), evaluable n=9 (received at least one dose), with 4 patients followed up to 22 mo.
line_of_therapy: recurrent setting following upfront chemoradiation and adjuvant temozolomide

title: First results of SURE-02: A phase 2 study of neoadjuvant sacituzumab govitecan (SG) plus pembrolizumab (Pembro), followed by response-adapted bladder sparing and adjuvant pembro, in patients with muscle-invasive bladder cancer (MIBC).
indication: muscle-invasive bladder cancer (MIBC)
treatment_arm: 4 cycles of Pembro 200 mg on D1 and SG 7.5 mg/Kg on D1 and D8, Q3W, followed by postsurgical Pembro x 13 cycles, Q3W.
study_population: Pts age ≥18 y, ECOG PS 0-1, with histologically confirmed cT2-T4N0M0 MIBC, ineligible/refusing CT, and scheduled for RC
study_size: Total planned sample size is n=48 in a 2-stage design; at the first stage n=23 were enrolled, n=40 were treated, and n=31 were efficacy evaluable.

investigational_product: mFOLFOXIRI combined with camrelizumab and bevacizumab
title: Neoadjuvant therapy with mFOLFOXIRI combined with camrelizumab and bevacizumab for microsatellite stable, locally advanced rectal cancer: A single-arm, open-label phase II study.
indication: microsatellite stable (MSS), locally advanced rectal cancer (LARC)
mechanism_of_action: PD-1 antibody
treatment_arm: intravenous administration of camrelizumab, bevacizumab, and mFOLFOXIRI for 4-6 cycles
study_population: patients with MSS-LARC aged between 18 and 70 years old
study_size: 32 patients were enrolled, with 29 patients included in the final analysis; the median follow-up time was 17.7 months.

title: Updated survival outcomes and predictors of benefit from ovarian function suppression in premenopausal women with hormone-receptor–positive breast cancer: Results from the ASTRRA trial.
indication: premenopausal women with hormone-receptor (HR)–positive breast cancer
control_arm: 5 years of TAM alone (TAM-only)
treatment_arm: 5 years of TAM with OFS for 2 years (TAM + OFS)
study_population: premenopausal women with hormone-receptor (HR)–positive breast cancer who remain premenopausal or resume menstruation after chemotherapy
study_size: A total of 1,282 premenopausal women were randomized 1:1; a HER2-negative cohort of n=776 was analyzed, including a high-risk subgroup of n=282. Median follow-up was 117.6 mo.

title: Nivolumab plus ipilimumab vs sunitinib for first-line treatment of advanced renal cell carcinoma: Final analysis from the phase 3 CheckMate 214 trial.
indication: first-line treatment of advanced renal cell carcinoma (aRCC)
mechanism_of_action: checkpoint inhibitor combination
control_arm: SUN 50 mg once daily for 4 weeks on, 2 weeks off
treatment_arm: NIVO 3 mg/kg + IPI 1 mg/kg Q3W×4 then NIVO (3 mg/kg or 240 mg Q2W or 480 mg Q4W)
study_population: Pts with clear cell aRCC, stratified by International Metastatic Renal Cell Carcinoma Database Consortium (IMDC) risk.
study_size: Randomized n=1096 (NIVO+IPI n=550, SUN n=546); ITT analysis set n=1096; I/P risk n=847 (NIVO+IPI n=425, SUN n=422); FAV risk n=249 (NIVO+IPI n=125, SUN n=124); median follow-up 9 years.

investigational_product: combination doublet gemcitabine-cisplatin (GP) and PD-1 inhibitor (Toripalimab)
title: Effect of induction chemo-immunotherapy on the chance for re-irradiation in high-risk recurrent nasopharyngeal carcinoma: A prospective, single-arm, phase II trial.
indication: high-risk recurrent nasopharyngeal carcinoma (rNPC)
mechanism_of_action: PD-1 inhibitor
treatment_arm: All patients received 3 cycles of GP + PD-1 inhibitor, then received reRT (GTV, 60-66Gy, 1.8-2.0Gy/f) plus PD-1 inhibitor if got CR/PR (reRT group), or received another 3 cycles of GP+PD-1 inhibitor if got SD (no reRT group), finally all got 4 cycles of PD-1 inhibitor maintenance.
study_population: Eligibility criteria included diagnosed as local ± regional recurrence after ≥1 year of radical treatment, not suitable for surgery, histologic or clinically diagnosis of NPC, stage rII-IVa (AJCC/UICC 8th), PRANCIS model > 252 points.
study_size: Recruited n=68 (reRT group n=44, no reRT group n=22); median follow-up 32.7 mo.

title: Induction chemotherapy with or without toripalimab followed by concurrent chemoradiotherapy for locoregionally advanced nasopharyngeal carcinoma: A multicenter, open-label, randomized, controlled, phase 2 trial.
indication: locoregionally advanced nasopharyngeal carcinoma (LANPC)
control_arm: intravenous gemcitabine (1g/m²) on days 1 and 8, and cisplatin (80 mg/m²) on day 1, every 3 weeks for 3 cycles, followed by standard CCRT (cisplatin 100 mg/m² every 3 weeks for 3 cycles)
treatment_arm: intravenous toripalimab (240 mg) on day 1 every 3 weeks for 3 induction cycles, plus intravenous gemcitabine (1g/m²) on days 1 and 8, and cisplatin (80 mg/m²) on day 1, every 3 weeks for 3 cycles, followed by standard CCRT (cisplatin 100 mg/m² every 3 weeks for 3 cycles)
study_population: Patients with locoregionally advanced nasopharyngeal carcinoma (LANPC) (T4NanyM0 or TanyN2/N3M0, AJCC 8th edition).
study_size: Randomized n=150 (toripalimab arm n=75; standard arm n=75) from 8 centers in China; data cut-off November 30, 2024; median follow-up 23.4 mo.
comparator: standard arm (gemcitabine and cisplatin IC followed by cisplatin concurrent chemoradiotherapy [CCRT])

title: Determining the recommended phase 2 dose (RP2D) of dose-intense irinotecan combined with IVA chemotherapy (I R IVA) in newly diagnosed very high risk rhabdomyosarcoma: A phase Ib study within the EpSSG Frontline and Relapsed Rhabdomyosarcoma study (FaR-RMS).
indication: newly diagnosed very high risk rhabdomyosarcoma (RMS)
treatment_arm: IVA (Ifosfamide 3000 mg/m² on days 1–2; vincristine 1.5 mg/m2 on days 1 and 8 and on day 15 in cycle 1 and 2 only; actinomycin D 1.5 mg/m2 on day 1) with irinotecan on days 8–12, with dose escalation from a starting dose of 20 mg/m²/day to a RP2D of 50mg/m2/day.
study_population: Patients aged >1 to ≤25 years with Very High Risk (VHR) RMS (FOXO1 fusion-positive, node-positive, Subgroup G and metastatic, Subgroup H).
study_size: Total enrolled n=22 across 4 dose levels (20 mg/m2/day, n=5; 30 mg/m2/day, n=5; 40 mg/m2/day, n=6; 50 mg/m2/day, n=6); all patients (n=22) were evaluable for DLTs.

title: Immunotherapy vs. chemotherapy run-in followed by pembrolizumab plus nab-paclitaxel in metastatic triple negative breast cancer (mTNBC): Results from a phase II study.
indication: metastatic triple negative breast cancer (mTNBC)
control_arm: chemotherapy run-in (cTNBC, nab-P before nab-P+pembro)
treatment_arm: immunotherapy run-in (iTNBC, pembro before nab-P+pembro)
study_population: PD-L1 unselected mTNBC, 0-2 prior lines of chemotherapy allowed.
study_size: Total enrolled n=50 (cTNBC n=30, iTNBC n=20); median follow-up 19.9 mo.

title: IPElife: Phase III, double-blind trial of cannabis sativa extract in pain management and quality of life in patients with metastatic lung cancer.
indication: Pain management and quality of life in patients with locally advanced or metastatic lung cancer.
control_arm: placebo
treatment_arm: The cannabis sativa extract administration protocol involved dose escalation, starting at 10mg/day, with titration every 5 days until the patients reached their goals or the maximum dose of 100mg/day.
study_population: patients with locally advanced or metastatic lung cancer confirmed by histopathology
study_size: Randomized n=40 (n=20 per group).

title: AURORA: A single arm, multicentre, phase II clinical trial of atezolizumab immunotherapy for advanced squamous cell carcinoma of the bladder and urinary tract.
indication: advanced squamous cell carcinoma of the bladder and urinary tract
treatment_arm: atezolizumab (1680 mg IV, q28d) until disease progression and for up to one year if tolerated
study_population: Patients had progressive, measurable, UTSCC and ECOG performance status 0-2. Mixed histology was permitted but with no urothelial carcinoma component. One prior line of systemic chemotherapy was permitted for advanced disease but no prior immunotherapy.
study_size: Stage 1 n=19 patients assessable for response (planned total n=33); median follow-up 10.1 mo.
line_of_therapy: One prior line of systemic chemotherapy was permitted for advanced disease

title: Neoadjuvant mFOLFOXIRI chemotherapy with or without cadonilimab versus mFOLFOX6 alone in locally advanced colorectal cancer: A randomized phase II study (OPTICAL2).
indication: locally advanced colorectal cancer (LACRC)
mechanism_of_action: dual immunotherapy
control_arm: mFOLFOXIRI for 6 cycles, or mFOLFOX6 alone for 6 cycles
treatment_arm: preoperative mFOLFOXIRI plus AK104 for 6 cycles
study_population: patients with II/III rectal ancer and locally advanced colon cancer (T3 ≥5 mm or T4)
study_size: Total randomized n=123 (n=41/arm); mITT analysis n=41 (mFOLFOXIRI+AK104), n=39 (mFOLFOXIRI), n=41 (mFOLFOX6); PP analysis n=36, n=35, n=37 respectively; data cutoff August 2024.
comparator: mFOLFOXIRI for 6 cycles or mFOLFOX6 alone for 6 cycles

title: OBX-115 engineered tumor-infiltrating lymphocyte (TIL) cell therapy with regulatable membrane-bound IL15 (mbIL15) in patients (pts) with immune checkpoint inhibitor (ICI)–resistant advanced melanoma: Phase 1 results of the Agni-01 multicenter study.
indication: immune checkpoint inhibitor (ICI)–resistant advanced melanoma
mechanism_of_action: OBX-115 TIL are engineered to express mbIL15 regulated by the FDA-approved small-molecule drug acetazolamide (ACZ), abrogating the need for toxic high-dose IL2 after TIL infusion.
treatment_arm: OBX-115 manufactured from pt tumor tissue and infused after standard- or low-dose (Cy 750 mg/m2/d × 3; Flu 30 mg/m2/d × 4) lymphodepletion (LD). Oral acetazolamide (ACZ) starts day of OBX-115 infusion (QD up to 14 d), and is redosed (QD up to 7 d) every 6 wks after recovery from LD. No IL2 is administered.
study_population: patients (pts) with immune checkpoint inhibitor (ICI)–resistant advanced melanoma
study_size: In phase 1, n=11 pts were infused, including n=6 treated at the RP2D, with a data cut-off of 01 Jan 2025 and a median study follow-up of 22.3 wks.

title: Phase Ib/II study of fluzoparib in combination with dalpiciclib in patients with locally advanced or metastatic sarcoma.
indication: locally advanced or metastatic sarcoma
mechanism_of_action: Poly ADP-ribose polymerase (PARP) plays a role in DNA damage repair, and PARP inhibitors can exert anti-tumor efficiency in tumors with homologous recombination repair defection (HRD). Cyclin-dependent kinase (CDK) plays an important role in cell cycle regulation. Rb is the direct substrate of CDK4/6, and Rb/E2F participates the HR-mediated DNA repair. Therefore, selective CDK4/6 inhibition can theoretically aggravate HRD and hinder DNA repair of tumor cells treated with PARP inhibitors.
treatment_arm: fluzoparib (0.1 or 0.15 g po., qd, q4w) and dalpiciclib (0.1, 0.125 or 0.15 g po., qd, d1-21, q4w) continuously until progressive disease (PD) or intolerable toxicity occurred.
study_population: Patients aged 12-75 years with locally advanced or metastatic sarcomas after first-line treatment, with at least one measurable lesion according to RECIST 1.1 criteria.
study_size: n=12 in the escalation part; data cut-off Jun. 10, 2025; median follow-up 7.93 mo.

title: A randomized phase III trial of catequentinib hydrochloride (AL3818) versus placebo in subjects with metastatic or advanced leiomyosarcoma (LMS).
indication: metastatic or advanced leiomyosarcoma (LMS)
mechanism_of_action: novel, orally administered, small molecule tyrosine kinase inhibitor
control_arm: placebo, with the option of crossover to Catequentinib after confirmed Progression Disease (PD) on placebo
treatment_arm: Catequentinib was administered in a 21-day cycle with 14 days on and 7 days off regimen.
study_population: Patients with a diagnosis of LMS requiring third or further line treatment.
study_size: Total enrolled n=111, treated and evaluated n=110, randomized n=74 to Catequentinib and n=36 to placebo.

title: Isatuximab, carfilzomib, lenalidomide, and dexamethasone (Isa-KRd) for high-risk (HR) newly diagnosed multiple myeloma (NDMM): First-time report of the full cohort of transplant-eligible (TE) patients in the GMMG-CONCEPT trial.
indication: high-risk (HR) newly diagnosed multiple myeloma (NDMM)
treatment_arm: Isa-KRd induction (6 cycles), intensification (HD-MEL+ASCT), 4 cycles Isa-KRd consolidation and 2 years Isa-KR maintenance.
study_population: Adult NDMM pts with HR disease, defined as ≥1 HR cytogenetic aberration (CA) (del(17p), t(4;14), t(14;16), ≥3 copies 1q21) in combination with ISS stage II/III.
study_size: Total included and dosed n=219 TE pts (and 26 TNE pts); MRD-analysis population n=209; data cut-off 9 Jan 2025; median follow-up 42 mo.

title: First-in-human phase 1/2a study of PBP1510 (anti-PAUF mAb) in advanced/metastatic pancreatic adenocarcinoma: Safety results from early combination cohorts.
indication: advanced/metastatic pancreatic adenocarcinoma
mechanism_of_action: PBP1510 is a first-in-class humanized anti-PAUF monoclonal antibody (mAb) with tumor-suppressing potential.
treatment_arm: PBP1510 at 1 mg/kg (N = 3), and 3 mg/kg (N = 3) in combination with gemcitabine (1000 mg/m2) in 28-day cycles.
study_population: Key eligibility criteria include locally advanced/metastatic pancreatic adenocarcinoma, disease progression following at least 1 previous line of chemotherapy, at least 1 measurable lesion by RECIST v1.1, ECOG value of 0-1, life expectancy of ≥ 3 months, and adequate baseline organ functions.
study_size: Total enrolled n=6 (1 mg/kg cohort n=3, 3 mg/kg cohort n=3); data cut-off 6 Jan 2025.
line_of_therapy: disease progression following at least 1 previous line of chemotherapy

title: Preliminary results from the dose-escalation stage of a phase I trial of an anti-CCR8 antibody in patients with relapsed/refractory cutaneous T-cell lymphoma (R/R CTCL).
indication: relapsed/refractory cutaneous T-cell lymphoma (R/R CTCL)
mechanism_of_action: humanized monoclonal antibody against CCR8 with potent ADCC activity
treatment_arm: ICP-B05 at 150 mg, 300 mg, 450 mg and 600 mg I.V. Q2W
study_population: Patients with relapsed/refractory cutaneous T-cell lymphoma (R/R CTCL) who failed at least 1 prior standard systemic regimen, with a median age of 46 years and a median of 3 prior lines of therapy.
study_size: A total of 13 patients were treated (n=4 at 150 mg, n=3 at 300 mg, n=3 at 450 mg, n=3 at 600 mg), with 12 patients evaluable for skin lesion assessment; data cut-off was 6th Jan, 2025.
line_of_therapy: failed at least 1 prior standard systemic regimen

title: A phase 1b/2, open-label study of selective Axl, Mer and CSF1R inhibitor adrixetinib (Q702) in combination with intravenous pembrolizumab in patients with selected advanced solid tumors: Results of a phase 1 study (QRNT-008).
indication: selected advanced solid tumors (esophageal, gastric/GEJ, hepatocellular, and cervical cancers) who have progressed on prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 treatment
mechanism_of_action: selective Axl, Mer and CSF1R inhibitor for which the primary mechanism of action of tumor regression is through immune-stimulating effects.
treatment_arm: Q702 (week on/off dosing regimen) orally at 100 mg or 120 mg doses in combination with pembrolizumab (200 mg Q3W) intravenously in 42-day cycles.
study_population: patients with advanced esophageal, gastric/GEJ, hepatocellular, and cervical cancers who have progressed on prior anti-PD-1/PD-L1 treatment.
study_size: Total n=29 patients received treatment (n=7 at 100 mg Q702, n=22 at 120 mg Q702); data cutoff was December 19th, 2024.
